definition: the process by which knowledge and understanding is developed in the mind
an opinion that all members of a group agree with
a way of life and set of ideas that are opposed to those accepted by most of society; a group of people who share such a way of life and such ideas
to remove somebody, especially a political leader, from power
to remove a king or queen from power; to remove somebody from a position of authority or power

an open sore on the outside of the body or on the surface of an organ inside the body, where there is a break in the skin or membrane covering the organ that fails to heal (= get better) without treatment
done by or involving all the people in the world or in a particular group
true or right at all times and in all places

objects made of jade
a bright green colour
a person who juggles, especially in order to entertain people
the act of joining two words using a hyphen; the division of a word between two lines of text using a hyphen

the holy book of the Jewish religion, consisting of the Torah (or Law), the prophets and the Writings
a copy of the holy book of the Christian or Jewish religion
a book containing important information on a subject, that you refer to very often
a bush or small tree with purple berries that are used in medicine and to add taste to gin
the use or study of images or symbols in art
the fact of depending on each other; the fact of consisting of parts that depend on each other
the activity of governing a country or controlling a company or an organization; the way in which a country is governed or a company or institution is controlled
used to emphasize an adjective or adverb
used to emphasize something you are saying or an opinion you are giving
used to express interest in or surprise at what somebody is saying
used to say what is actually the fact or the truth about something
used, often in negative sentences, to reduce the force of something you are saying
used in questions and negative sentences when you want somebody to say ‘no’
used to show that you think something that somebody has done is bad
connected with technology
not using wires

to sell a business or an industry so that it is no longer owned by the government
to stop doing, using or providing something, especially something that you have been doing, using or providing regularly
to stop making a product
having almost no taste
not interesting or exciting

empty; not being used
if a job in a company is vacant, nobody is doing it and it is available for somebody to take

a place, usually including buildings, used for a particular purpose or activity
a special feature of a machine, service, etc. that makes it possible to do something extra
a natural ability to learn or do something easily

a red substance in the blood that carries oxygen and contains iron
the process by which mental and physical characteristics are passed by parents to their children; these characteristics in a particular person

similar in position, structure, etc. to something else
a shape like a spiral or a line curved around a cylinder or cone
